title: Brothers charged with filing a false police report in College Station shooting
content:
Christian Diaz-Perez, 20, and Jesus Angel Estrada, 18, were both charged on Saturday with filing a false police report.
College Station officers responded to the East Mark apartments off Central Park Lane on Friday just after 9 p.m. for reports of a shooting. At the apartment complex, police found a man who had been shot. His injuries were treated and he has been released from the hospital.
Police said Diaz-Perez and Estrada told detectives they had been walking on Central Park Lane when the man was shot, but they were unable to relay any details about the incident and said they did not hear or see anything prior to the gunshot.
Both men gave the same vague account, according to the police report, and the person who was shot offered nearly the same story while being interviewed at the hospital.
Detectives said they found a bullet hole inside the apartment and evidence indicated that the men were lying about what happened.
According to the police report, Estrada eventually admitted to police that he was sitting on the bed in the bedroom playing with a gun when it went off, striking the other man in the face.
Filing a false report to a police officer is a Class B misdemeanor punishable by up to six months in jail and a $2,000 fine.
